Authors: Dian Sano A.V., Nindito H., Madyatmadja E.D., Sianipar C.P.M.
Title: Modeling prim's algorithm for tour agencies' minimum traveling paths to increase profitability
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Graduate School of Global Environmental Studies (GSGES), Graduate School of Agriculture (GSA), Division of Environmental Science and Technology, Kyoto University, Department of Global Ecology, Kitashirakawa, Oiwakecho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8502, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Dian Sano, A.V., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nindito, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Madyatmadja, E.D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sianipar, C.P.M., Graduate School of Global Environmental Studies (GSGES), Graduate School of Agriculture (GSA), Division of Environmental Science and Technology, Kyoto University, Department of Global Ecology, Kitashirakawa, Oiwakecho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8502, Japan
Abstract: This study aims at modeling tour agencies' best traveling paths using prim's algorithm and applicable in any tourism cities. In this case we take the area of Greater Malang, which has a lot of tourism sites, as part of this study. By this model, it is expected to help tour agencies in any tourism cities to set up the best traveling paths as part of their daily businesses. From the business perspective, this will increase efficiencies in the sense of saving time, fuel and cost of transportation, and in turn, it leads to an increase of business profitability. These efficiencies also apply on the customer side, i.e., the tourists because they also save their time and implicitly this will impact to the quality of their time spent in tourism sites. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Minimum traveling paths; Modeling; Prim's algorithm; Tourism sites
Index Keywords: Efficiency; Information management; Profitability; Business perspective; Cost of transportation; Prim's algorithm; Time spent; Tourism

Authors: Madyatmadja E.D., Dian Sano A.V., Sianipar C.P.M., Nindito H., Bhaskoro R.A.
Title: Factors influencing the uses of social media within the government: A systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Graduate School of Global Environmental Studies (GSGES), Graduate School of Agriculture (GSA), Kyoto University, Kitashirakawa, Oiwakecho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8502, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Madyatmadja, E.D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sianipar, C.P.M., Graduate School of Global Environmental Studies (GSGES), Graduate School of Agriculture (GSA), Kyoto University, Kitashirakawa, Oiwakecho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto, 606-8502, Japan; Nindito, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bhaskoro, R.A., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social media has been stated as influencing activities of the government especially in interacting with citizens. However, there are less understandings on factors influencing the uses. Looking at existing literature, the uses of social media within a government are focused on transparency, openness, collaboration, and citizen participation. Hence, this study aims at investigating factors influencing the uses. Four theories being considered intentionally follow prior researches (i.e., transparency, openness, participation, and collaboration). Particularly, this study attempts to examine factors influencing people behavior within a government in using social media to accomplish their activities in various aspects, including politics, economics, social, culture, defense, and security. Besides, the uses are observed in several governmental tasks such as dealing with complaints, reports and documentation, critics and suggestions, and information dissemination to citizens. Therefore, this study will deliver a new understanding to the government on factors influencing their uses of social media, including how they might use social media accordingly to the needs of their citizens. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Citizen interaction; Collaboration; Government; Information; Openness; Participation; Social media; Transparency
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Economics; Information dissemination; Information management; Transparency; Citizen participation; People behavior; Social media; Systematic literature review; Social networking (online)

Authors: Nindito H., Madyatmadja E.D., Dian Sano A.V.
Title: Evaluation of E-government services based on social media using structural equation modeling
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Study Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nindito, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Madyatmadja, E.D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Computer Science Study Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia
Abstract: Today many local governments have provided aspiration services or social media based complaints about the community to participate in giving aspirations and report problems that occur around the area. To improve the usefulness of this service, we conduct research with the aim of evaluating and identifying the factors that affect the service's application. The impact of this study is that the government can provide services according to the wishes of the community, because the model found can be a reference for the government to increase public trust and satisfaction for users of government services. The influence on the adoption of Aspiration Services is explained by using perceptions of trust, attitudes, and intentions of use that refer to technology acceptance models (TAM). Data processing and analysis in our research using the SEM-PLS method (Structural Equation Model-Partial Least Square). The results in this research will present that services applying technology that gain a positive effect on the awareness of usability and benefit for service users. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Data handling; e-government; Information management; Information services; Least squares approximations; Aspiration services; Data processing and analysis; E-government services; Government services; Partial least square (PLS); Perceptions of trust; Structural equation modeling; Technology acceptance model; Social networking (online)

Authors: Condrobimo A.R., Nindito H., Dian Sano A.V., Kosala R., Ranti B., Harso Supangkat S.
Title: Cluster Analysis Application at the Five Largest Airports in Indonesia to Carry Out a Tax-Free Policy
Source title: Proceeding - 2018 International Conference on ICT for Smart Society: Innovation Toward Smart Society and Society 5.0, ICISS 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science, Institut Teknologi Kreatif Bina Nusantara, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Faculty of Computer Science, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Sekolah Teknik Elektro Dan Informatika, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Condrobimo, A.R., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nindito, H., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Computer Science, Institut Teknologi Kreatif Bina Nusantara, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Kosala, R., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduated Program-Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ranti, B., Faculty of Computer Science, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Harso Supangkat, S., Sekolah Teknik Elektro Dan Informatika, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this study is to apply cluster analysis on Indonesia's international tourism data set. Algorithm used in this cluster analysis is k-means and the number of cluster (k) is four and the similarity measurement between members of clusters is based on Euclidean distance. The source of data set was taken from Ministry of Tourism portal of Republic of Indonesia per November 2017. The results of this cluster analysis is presented in a table consisting of four clusters and each cluster consists of its members. Cluster analysis in this study can be used more quickly and efficiently to identify countries which will be the promotional and campaign targets on tax-free incentives for foreign tourists assuming a constraint that promotional and campaign budgets are always limited so that the related policy makers need to set a priority on targeted countries. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Budget control; Cluster analysis; Data mining; Euclidean distance; Indonesia; International tourisms; Number of clusters; Policy makers; Similarity measurements; tax-free; Tourism portal; Economic analysis

Authors: Nindito H., Condrobimo A.R., Dian Sano A.V.
Title: Rule based classification for diseases articles using oracle database 12c
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nindito, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Condrobimo, A.R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The main problem faced by business companies or institutions today is too much information that is in circulation and cannot be properly processed. On the other hand, the process of sorting out useful documents from existing documents to generate useful information poses both individual and organizational challenges. This paper presents a model on how to classify by loading documents into Oracle database and using rule-based classification for further action. The result can be classified according to the categories defined and formulated before, stored in the database and making it easier for decision makers. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Database systems; Decision making; Information management; Information retrieval systems; Business companies; Decision makers; Document; Oracle 12c; Oracle database; Rule based; Rule-based classification; Sorting outs; Classification (of information)

Authors: Didik Madyatmadja E., Dian Sano A.V., Suliyanti W.N., Chondro R.A.
Title: Advanced usage of ticketing report dashboard in airlines
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science, STT PLN, Jakarta, Indonesia; Business and Economics, Monash University, Australia
Authors with affiliations: Didik Madyatmadja, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suliyanti, W.N., Computer Science, STT PLN, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chondro, R.A., Business and Economics, Monash University, Australia
Abstract: Capability of airlines in adopting technology for processing data into information and knowledge serves as a defense tool in business world. Information system facilitates management to obtain high quality information in decision making. As in ticket sales report, airline businesses already started to implement real-time sales report in the form of Ticketing Report Dashboard. This research aims to analyse and evaluate Ticketing Report Dashboard with Technology Acceptance Model (TAM), which looks at the effect of five variables in two key factors i.e. perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use using a sample of 101 respondents, consists of 93 staffs and 8 supervisors. Sample Technique was Simple Random Sampling. Data collected from questionnaires and processed with SPSS version 24. The result is that all hypothesis-12 corelation hypothesis and 6 regression hypothesis-can be accepted. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Nindito H., Madyatmadja E.D., Dian Sano A.V.
Title: Database replication in heterogenous platform
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nindito, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Madyatmadja, E.D., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Dian Sano, A.V., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The application of diverse database technologies in enterprises today is increasingly a common practice. To provide high availability and survavibality of real-time information, a database replication technology that has capability to replicate databases under heterogenous platforms is required. The purpose of this research is to find the technology with such capability. In this research, the data source is stored in MSSQL database server running on Windows. The data will be replicated to MySQL running on Linux as the destination. The method applied in this research is prototyping in which the processes of development and testing can be done interactively and repeatedly. The key result of this research is that the replication technology applied, which is called Oracle GoldenGate, can successfully manage to do its task in replicating data in real-time and heterogeneous platforms. © 2014 Science Publication.
Author Keywords: Heterogen; MySQL; Real time; Replication; SQL Server
References: Ahmad, N., Abdalla, A.N., Sidek, R.M., Data replication using read-one-write-all monitoring synchronization transaction system in distributed environment (2010) J. Comput.
